Corfu Town has some flat parts (like around the Liston and Spianada) and ramps in key areas (museums, the new fortress, etc.) so a wheelchair user can explore parts of it, albeit with cobblestones in some streets. Some beaches, like Dassia or parts of Ipsos, are flat and have accessible facilities (and at times even amphibious wheelchairs for swimming, though those programs vary by year). Large resorts (e.g., in Dassia or Kommeno) often have good accessibility and you can visit their restaurants or beach areas. We can provide specific guidance or contact a local tour service that offers wheelchair-friendly excursions to ensure you see the beauty of Corfu with minimal obstacles.

faq.q: Does the pool have any accessibility features, such as handrails or a lift?
faq.a: The infinity pool at Villa Orama is sleek in design and does not have a specialized pool lift or zero-entry ramp. It is accessed by standard built-in steps in one corner. There is a handrail at the very top of those steps to assist with entry and exit, but it’s the typical pool style ladder/rail rather than a full ramp. If swimming is a therapy or a must for a guest with mobility issues, and they have some ability to use steps with assistance, it might be feasible, but if a guest cannot use steps at all, unfortunately the pool would not be accessible to them. They could still enjoy the terrace and perhaps the hot tub if getting in is easier, but the main pool doesn’t have specialized accessibility adaptations.

faq.q: Is there an easily accessible ground-floor bathroom and bedroom?
faq.a: All bedrooms and their en-suite bathrooms are on the ground floor, which is very convenient. You won’t need to climb stairs to reach any bedroom. However, ‘ground floor’ in this sense is the same level as the living area and pool terrace (after you’ve ascended the initial entry steps). Each bedroom’s en-suite is a step-in bathroom (no bathtub except the one open-air tub in the master, but even that has a step to get in). None of the showers are barrier-free (they have a small lip to keep water in). If someone cannot step into a shower, we might place a stool and a handheld shower attachment to help them bathe with assistance. So while everything is on one floor (great for accessibility), the bathrooms aren’t fully wheelchair-adapted, but manageable for someone with some mobility who perhaps uses a walker or walking stick.

faq.q: What should guests with mobility issues consider before booking Villa Orama?
faq.a: We encourage guests with mobility concerns to discuss specifics with us. Important points: there are a few unavoidable steps (especially at the entrance), and standard bathroom layouts. If a guest can handle a couple of steps with help and doesn’t require fully wheelchair-adapted facilities, they will likely be comfortable. If a guest is fully wheelchair-bound and independent movement is crucial, the villa might pose difficulties, since door widths and shower access aren’t optimized for wheelchairs. In summary, Villa Orama works well for those with minor mobility limitations (perhaps the elderly who can walk slowly or someone using a cane), but it’s not ideal for severe mobility impairments without significant assistance. We’ll be transparent in evaluating your needs to ensure the villa is a good fit for your party.

faq.q: Are pets allowed at Villa Orama?
faq.a: Yes, we are pet-friendly on a case-by-case basis. Well-behaved dogs (usually up to medium size) are welcome at Villa Orama with prior approval from the owner/manager. We understand pets are part of the family! If you’d like to bring a pet, just let us know in advance with details (breed, size, trained, etc.) and we will likely be able to accommodate. We just ensure that certain basic rules are agreed upon to keep the property in great condition and respect future guests who may have allergies.

faq.q: Is there an additional fee or deposit for bringing a pet?
faq.a: We may charge a small additional cleaning fee for a pet, or request an extra security deposit, just to cover any extra cleaning (like pet hair removal) or the slight increased risk of wear and tear. Typically the pet cleaning fee is a modest flat amount. Assuming no pet-related damage, any pet deposit would be fully refundable. Service animals, of course, are exempt from fees. We’ll be transparent about any costs in advance, so you’ll know exactly what to expect.

faq.q: What house rules apply to pets during the stay?
faq.a: We ask that pets be house-trained and not allowed on the beds or furniture (to prevent scratches or fur build-up on upholstery). Please clean up after your pet in the villa grounds (we can provide waste bags). We also request that you do not leave pets unattended in the house or garden for long periods, especially if they might become anxious – a bored pet could scratch doors or cause disturbance. If your dog is a swimmer, kindly rinse them off after the beach before they jump in the pool, to help keep the pool clean. These simple guidelines help ensure that having a pet doesn’t affect the luxury experience for you or future guests. We find that pet owners are usually very responsible, so it rarely is an issue.

faq.q: Can dogs enjoy the beach and outdoor areas around the villa?
faq.a: Yes, there are plenty of outdoor opportunities for dogs. The villa’s private garden/grounds give your dog space to sniff and play (just keep an eye on them because, while the property is fenced/gated, an agile dog might find an escape route if determined). Many of the nearby beaches (like those small coves) are not crowded and you’ll often see locals walking their dogs there, especially in the early morning or evening. Officially, dogs should be on leash on public beaches, but if the beach is quiet and your dog is under voice control, you’ll have flexibility. We only ask that you ensure your dog doesn’t disturb other guests or damage anything. Otherwise, by all means let them enjoy the sea and nature – it’s a dog’s holiday too!

faq.q: Is the property fully fenced to contain pets?
faq.a: The property is largely fenced and enclosed, especially around the main living areas and parking, which helps keep pets contained. However, the perimeter goes into some olive groves and greenery where a small determined dog might find gaps or jump a low wall. We recommend supervising your pet when outdoors just to be safe. Most dogs will be fine exploring the immediate terrace and garden area, but if your pet is an escape artist, you may want to keep them leashed or within sight. We can show you the layout on arrival so you know where the boundaries are secure.

faq.q: Are pet-sitting or dog-walking services available if we go out for the day?
faq.a: If you plan an all-day excursion where pets aren’t allowed (for example, a long boat trip or a visit to a museum), we can assist in arranging a pet-sitter or dog-walker to check in on your pet or take them for a walk. We have contacts with reliable pet care providers on the island. They can either stay with your pet at the villa for a few hours or do visits as needed. Just let us know your schedule and we’ll find a solution so your furry friend is looked after and happy while you’re out enjoying Corfu.

faq.q: Are there veterinarians nearby in case of pet emergencies?
faq.a: Yes, there are veterinary clinics on the island and even one in the north. The closest vet service is in Acharavi (around 25 minutes from the villa) and there’s also a veterinary clinic in Corfu Town. Additionally, there’s a vet who makes rounds in the Kassiopi area by appointment. If your pet needs medical attention, our team will help you get in touch with a vet or arrange an appointment. We can also guide you to the nearest pet pharmacy for any pet medications. Hopefully it won’t be needed, but it’s good to know it’s available.

faq.q: Do you accept pets other than dogs, such as cats?
faq.a: We consider pets on a case-by-case basis. Dogs are the most common and generally welcome with approval. For other animals (cats, birds, etc.), it’s not our usual practice to host them due to concerns like allergies and property considerations, but we wouldn’t automatically say no – please inquire and tell us about your pet. We’ve found that cats can be a bit tricky in a new environment and may scratch furniture or try to escape, so we’d need assurances and a plan for a cat’s comfort and safety. In all cases, we’ll try to be accommodating if possible, as long as we’re confident the pet won’t detract from the villa’s condition or future guests’ comfort.

faq.q: What is the climate like in Corfu and the northeast region?
faq.a: Corfu has a classic Mediterranean climate. Summers (June through August) are generally hot, sunny, and dry, while winters (December through February) are mild but can be rainy. The northeast region where Villa Orama is located benefits from refreshing breezes off the sea in summer and is one of the lushest parts of Corfu thanks to rainfall in the cooler months. Overall, you can expect long sunny days during the main tourist season, comfortable shoulder seasons, and green landscapes due to winter rains. Corfu is known as the Emerald Island for its greenery – so unlike some arid Greek isles, it remains verdant even in summer.

faq.q: What are typical summer temperatures and sea conditions in Corfu?
faq.a: In July and August, daytime high temperatures in Corfu typically reach around 30–35°C (86–95°F). At night, it cools down to the low-mid 20s°C (70s°F), which is pleasant for evenings outdoors. Humidity is moderate, and the area sees plenty of sunshine (10-12 hours of sun a day). The sea is wonderfully warm by mid-summer – surface water temperatures average 24–27°C (mid-70s°F), making swimming very comfortable. The Ionian Sea is generally calm around the northeast; occasionally a light afternoon breeze (maestros wind) can pick up, which sailors enjoy, but it typically doesn’t disrupt swimming or boating. Overall, summer offers ideal beach and pool weather.

faq.q: Is May or September a good time to visit Corfu?
faq.a: Both May and September are fantastic times to visit if you prefer slightly milder temperatures and fewer crowds. In May, you’ll experience spring-like conditions: expect daytime highs around 23–27°C (73–80°F) and cooler nights around 15–18°C (59–64°F). The island is in bloom and very green, though note the sea is warming up from winter and is usually around 19–22°C (still a bit refreshing for long swims, but tolerable). September is one of our favorite months – summer warmth lingers with highs about 28–30°C (82–86°F) early in the month, dipping to mid-20s°C later. The sea is at its warmest (24–25°C) after heating all summer. The crowds start to thin after the first week, making it peaceful but everything is still open. Both months see plenty of sun and very little rain (especially May tends to be dry, though by late September you might get a short shower or two).

faq.q: What is spring like on Corfu (March, April)?
faq.a: Spring in Corfu is beautiful and relatively mild. March can be cool to mild – with daytime temperatures around 16–19°C (60–66°F) and still chilly nights around 10°C (50°F). By April, highs reach the upper teens to low 20s Celsius (65–72°F) and nights become milder (around 12–15°C). Rainfall tapers off significantly compared to winter, but spring showers can occur. The island’s flora is at its peak: wildflowers everywhere, green hills – it’s great for hiking and exploring villages. While it’s too cool for most to swim (sea temperature is about 16–18°C in early spring), the weather is pleasant for outdoor activities. Also, Easter in Corfu (which often falls in April) is a huge cultural event, with processions and celebrations, offering a fascinating cultural experience for spring visitors.

faq.q: Can you swim in the sea in October?
faq.a: Early October often still feels like an extension of summer in Corfu. Daytime temperatures usually hover in the mid-20s°C (mid-70s°F), and the sea temperature in early October is around 22–24°C (low 70s°F) – which is generally comfortable for swimming, especially for those used to the Mediterranean. As October progresses, temperatures gradually dip and the chance of rain increases, particularly later in the month. By late October, highs in the low 20s and sea temps around 20°C mean swimming is for the more adventurous, and you’ll want a light jacket in the evenings. Many people do enjoy the beach through mid-October without issue. Plus, October offers the benefit of fall colors in the landscape and the olive harvest beginning – it’s a quieter, picturesque time on the island.

faq.q: How are the winters in Corfu if we visit in the off-season?
faq.a: Corfu’s winters are mild compared to northern Europe but can be wet. From November to February, expect daytime temperatures roughly 10–16°C (50–60°F). Nights can drop to around 5–8°C (40s°F) on the coldest occasions. It’s sweater and jacket weather, but rarely frost – snow is almost unheard of in the lowlands (occasionally the mountain tops get a dusting). The island gets the majority of its rainfall in winter, which is why it stays so green. You’ll find a very quiet Corfu in winter: most tourist facilities close, and life is slow-paced and local. However, the villa with its heating and fireplace can be a cozy retreat if you enjoy tranquility, walks in nature, and the dramatic waves and skies of wintertime. Just come prepared for the possibility of rain and enjoy the island’s serene off-season beauty.

faq.q: Does the northeast coast experience strong winds or weather systems?
faq.a: The northeast coast of Corfu is generally sheltered compared to some other Greek islands. We don’t get the strong Meltemi winds that the Aegean islands do in summer. Summer winds here are usually light and welcome (a gentle breeze on a hot day). Occasionally, a northerly wind (Maistros) can pick up, offering great sailing conditions, but it’s rarely disruptive. Thunderstorms can occur on hot humid days, but they tend to be brief. In late autumn, the area can get breezy when weather fronts pass, and you might see some spectacular lightning over the sea, but the villa itself is in a safe, elevated position. We always secure outdoor umbrellas when a storm is expected, just as a precaution. Overall, weather extremes are infrequent; the climate is generally quite gentle in this corner of Corfu.

faq.q: When is the overall best time to stay at Villa Orama?
faq.a:
It really depends on your preferences: 
- **July and August** are best if you love guaranteed hot weather, a vibrant atmosphere, and full summer buzz (great for nightlife and busy beaches). 
- **Late June and early September** often strike a perfect balance – very warm and summery but a bit less crowded and slightly gentler heat. 
- **May and October** are wonderful for a mix of warm (not hot) weather, quieter surroundings, and enjoying nature – you can often swim during these months too (especially in May-end or early Oct). 
- If you value tranquility above all, **April or even off-season months** let you experience the island’s culture and scenery without tourism, but with cooler weather.

For most guests, we often recommend mid-June or September as the "sweet spots" for a luxury villa stay: you get the summer feel and villa pool experience with just a touch more serenity. But truly, Villa Orama is a delight whenever you choose to visit!

faq.q: What makes Villa Orama’s location unique compared to other villas?
faq.a: Villa Orama is blessed with a location that combines rare elements: it’s perched on a private hillside offering panoramic views, yet it’s only a few minutes’ drive from charming coastal villages and beaches. Many villas in Corfu are either right by the sea (lovely, but they may lack privacy or elevation for views), or tucked further inland. Orama gives you that eagle’s nest vantage point – you see the Ionian Sea, the coastline, and even another country (Albania) – while still being close to the action. Additionally, the northeast coast is the most sought-after area in Corfu for upscale travelers. The villa sits in a peaceful traditional hamlet, so you experience authentic local ambiance, unlike some villas in busy resort areas. In short, Orama’s location offers a perfect blend of seclusion, scenery, and convenience.

faq.q: How special are the views from Villa Orama?
faq.a: The views are truly exceptional and one of the villa’s defining features. From virtually every part of the property – whether you’re in the living room, on the pool deck, or waking up in your bedroom – you have sight of the sea and often the coastline of Corfu and mountains of Albania. By day, the expanse of blue water and green hills is soothing and grand. You can watch boats sailing between Corfu and the mainland, and see the pretty harbor of Kassiopi below. By night, you might catch the twinkling lights of distant villages across the channel and a moonlit sea. Guests often mention that photos can’t do the panorama justice – it’s something you have to experience. Whether it’s sunrise with coffee or an evening glass of wine with the view, the scenery at Villa Orama leaves a lasting impression.

faq.q: What distinguishes the villa’s pool and outdoor living spaces?
faq.a: Villa Orama’s outdoor areas are designed to wow. The infinity lap pool (19 meters long) is quite unique – it’s longer than most villa pools, allowing for proper lap swimming. Its infinity edge creates a visual effect where the pool seems to merge with the treetops and sea beyond, giving swimmers a thrilling sensation of floating in the sky. Surrounding the pool is a spacious terrace with stylish sun loungers and a shaded lounge area – carefully furnished for maximum comfort. The outdoor dining area and barbecue corner make it easy to live outside all day. In the evenings, the pool and terrace lighting create a magical ambience for relaxation or entertaining. Many villas have nice pools, but Orama’s combination of pool design, view, and ample elegant outdoor space takes it to a five-star resort level, but it’s all exclusively yours.

faq.q: Does the villa offer any spa-like or wellness experiences on-site?
faq.a: Yes, we can help bring wellness and spa experiences to you at Villa Orama. The tranquil setting is perfect for private yoga or Pilates sessions on the terrace at sunrise – we can arrange for a qualified instructor to come to the villa. Additionally, massage and spa therapists are available on-call. We can set up a massage station outdoors in the shade or inside the villa, and you can indulge in a relaxing massage, facial, or beauty treatment with the sounds of nature in the background. There is also a hot tub on the terrace for a therapeutic soak. Essentially, we aim to provide a full wellness retreat experience if you desire – without you having to leave the property.

faq.q: Is Villa Orama suitable for special photo shoots or content creation?
faq.a: Absolutely. The villa’s sleek architecture, designer interiors, and breathtaking backdrop make it a fantastic setting for photo shoots, whether it’s for lifestyle, fashion, or family portraits. We’ve had guests use Orama as a setting for professional photos and even small film projects (with permission). Every corner is photogenic – from the infinity pool with its view to the stylish living room with floor-to-ceiling glass. If you intend to do any organized photo or video shoot, just let us know so we can discuss any necessary arrangements (such as timing to respect neighbors’ privacy, etc.). But yes, even for your personal vacation photos, you’ll find the villa provides an Instagram-worthy scene at every turn!

faq.q: How does Villa Orama compare to other luxury villas in Corfu?
faq.a: Villa Orama stands out for several reasons. Firstly, it’s brand new and architect-designed, which means you get modern aesthetics (clean lines, open spaces, big glass panels) and the latest amenities – whereas some Corfu villas can be older or more traditional in style. Secondly, the attention to indoor-outdoor flow is exceptional. Many villas have nice interiors but less thought-out outdoor areas; Orama was designed by an architect passionate about blending the two, so you have this seamless experience and every room opens to a view. Service-wise, Orama offers concierge-level assistance similar to what you’d get at a luxury boutique hotel, combined with the privacy of a standalone home. Finally, the location in Kremithas is prime – you’re basically in the ‘VIP’ belt of Corfu (the Rothschild estate and some of the island’s most famous villas are in this vicinity), which speaks to the quality of the surroundings. All in all, Orama delivers a level of design, comfort, and location that even among luxury Corfu villas is top-tier.

faq.q: Does the villa offer a good balance of privacy and access to activities?
faq.a: Yes, this balance is one of Villa Orama’s strongest advantages. On the property, you are in a world of your own – not overlooked by tourist crowds or neighboring hotels. You can swim in the pool or sunbathe in complete privacy. The only sounds are likely birds and cicadas. Yet, whenever you want a change of pace, you’re just a short drive from places like Kassiopi and Agios Stefanos where you can dine out, browse shops, or hop on a boat. You can easily go from utter seclusion to social and back in the span of an afternoon. Many guests split their days – quiet mornings at the villa, afternoons at the beach or exploring, then back to their sanctuary. In essence, Villa Orama serves as a serene retreat without cutting you off from the fun and convenience of Corfu’s attractions.

faq.q: Who is Villa Orama best suited for?
faq.a:
Villa Orama is ideal for discerning travelers who seek a blend of luxury, tranquility, and authentic locale. It works wonderfully for:
- **Families**: either one large family or two families traveling together (the 4 bedrooms give everyone space, and the one-level layout is great for kids).
- **Groups of friends**: looking for a stylish getaway with equal measures of relaxation (pool, views, services) and adventure (water sports, nightlife trips to town).
- **Couples retreat**: sometimes we have an extended family of adult couples or a few couples vacationing together – each gets a beautiful bedroom suite and you share the common luxury spaces.
- **Special occasions**: such as a milestone birthday, a small reunion, or an intimate wedding/proposal setting.

Given the high-end nature of the villa, it particularly appeals to guests who might usually stay in 5-star hotels but want the privacy and space of a villa, as well as those who appreciate modern design. If your idea of a perfect holiday is waking up to breathtaking views, having concierge-style help at hand, and enjoying a private resort-like atmosphere, Villa Orama will suit you perfectly.
